FinancialMarketSimulation.jl

Welcome to the documentation for FinancialMarketSimulation.jl.

Overview

This package provides a modular framework for simulating financial markets using Stochastic Differential Equations (SDEs).

API Reference

FinancialMarketSimulation.ExcessReturnProcess — Type
ExcessReturnProcess

Calculates the excess return of an asset over a risk-free rate: Ret = (St / S{t-1} - 1) - (r{t-1} * dt)

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.GenericSDEProcess — Type
GenericSDEProcess{F1, F2}

A flexible SDE process: dXt = μ(t, Xt, deps...)dt + σ(t, Xt, deps...) ⋅ dWt. Now supports dependencies: a list of other process names (symbols) whose values will be passed to the drift/diffusion functions.

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.InflationBondProcess — Type
InflationBondProcess{R, I}

Holds reference to Rate, Inflation, and a vector of Market Risk Factors.

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.MarketConfig — Type
MarketConfig

The master configuration for the simulation.

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.NominalBondProcess — Type
NominalBondProcess{R}

Holds reference to the Rate Process and a vector of Market Risk Factors.

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.SimpleReturnProcess — Type
SimpleReturnProcess

Calculates the simple (discrete) return of an asset: Rt = (St / S_{t-1}) - 1

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.SimulationWorld — Type
SimulationWorld

Holds the simulated paths in a memory-efficient ComponentArray. T is the element type (Float64). C is the specific ComponentArray type (generated at runtime).

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.VasicekProcess — Type
VasicekProcess

A specialized Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process: drt = κ(θ - rt)dt + σ dW_t

Fields

  • name::Symbol

  • κ::Float64

  • θ::Float64

  • σ::Float64

  • initial_value::Float64

  • shock_idx::Int64

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.get_time_index — Method

Calculates the single index corresponding to a specific time.

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.get_time_indices — Method

Calculates the indices in the data array corresponding to the requested time range.

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.plot_simulation — Method
plot_simulation(world; ...)

Plots simulation results with flexible options.

Arguments

  • vars: List of symbols to plot (e.g. [:r, :S]). Defaults to all.
  • time_range: Tuple (start, end) for the trajectory x-axis.
  • output_dir: Folder to save plots.
  • plot_traj: Bool, show trajectories (default true).
  • plot_dist: Bool, show distribution histogram (default true).
  • dist_time: Real, specific time for the histogram. Defaults to time_range[2].
source
FinancialMarketSimulation.shock_indices — Method
shock_indices(p::AbstractMarketProcess) -> Vector{Int}

Interface method to retrieve the shock indices used by a process. Default implementation assumes the struct has a field shock_idxs. Future developers can override this if their struct uses a different field name.

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.simulate! — Method

Simulate Excess Returns. Ret = (St / S{t-1} - 1) - (r{t-1} * dt)

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.simulate! — Method
simulate!(storage, process, world)

Runs the Euler-Maruyama scheme for a GenericSDEProcess. Supports dependency injection: passes values of dependent paths to drift/diffusion.

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.simulate! — Method

Simulate Simple Returns. Rt = St / S_{t-1} - 1

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.simulate! — Method
simulate!(storage, process::VasicekProcess, world)

Optimized Euler-Maruyama stepper for the Vasicek model.

source
FinancialMarketSimulation.simulate_correlated_shocks — Method
simulate_correlated_shocks(sims, steps, dt, corr_matrix)

Generates correlated Brownian motions dW using Cholesky decomposition. Dimensions: (sims, steps, n_shocks)

source

Summary

  1. Internal Helpers (get_time_index): The checkdocs = :exports setting will stop the error for these.
  2. Public API (VasicekProcess): The index.md with @autodocs will display these, resolving the error.
